info.title: Content Management API
info.description: Content Management API offers alows access to repositories of unstructured content such as documents, templates and images organized into folder structure. API exposes operations to upload and download content and manipulate its metadata. Document binary content is streamed as appropriate MIME media type.

get.summary: Get information about the specific repository

440.description:
Your request was well constructed but it does not comply with business policy. Consider the following possible problems and look into response for more details:
- [folder-locked]()
- [folder-archived]()

post.summary: Upload multiple documents to folder in one request
post.description: Multiple documents are uploaded within single request as base64 encoded byre array with surrounding json. Once server receives complete request it stores it one by one in a backing repository. Storing files into backing repository is not transactional operation. Content stream size must not exceed `50 MB`. Maximum nuber of documents is `5`. Metadata will be matched with content streams in order they are submitted.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: Comma separated list of file names

parameters.name: media-types
parameters.description: Comma separated list of MIME Media Types that describes format of the docuements content streams as deﬁned by RFC2045 and RFC2046. Commonly used media type examples are image/png, image/jpg, application/pdf and application/msword

parameters.name: filing-purposes
parameters.description: Comma sepparated list of classification values explaining intended use of the uploaded documents within business. Commonly used filing purposes are arrangement-document, mandate-document and profile-photo. For a complete list of possible values see [filing-purpose]() classification.

parameters.name: filing-case-numbers
parameters.description: Comma separated list of identifies of the cases related to uploaded documents such as arrangment-number and workitem-number.

440.description:
Your request was well constructed but it does not comply with business policy. Consider the following possible problems and look into response for more details:
- [folder-locked]()
- [folder-archived]()
- [max-upload-size-exceeded]()

delete.description: WARNING: This operation deletes folder with all contents and subdirectories

440.description:
Your request was refused due to business policy. Consider the following possible problems and look into response for more details:
- [folder-locked]()
- [folder-archived]()

post.description: Content stream size must not exceed 50 MB.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the file with extension

parameters.name: media-type
parameters.description: MIME Media Type that describes format of the docuements content stream as deﬁned by RFC2045 and RFC2046. Commonly used media type examples are image/png, image/jpg, application/pdf and application/msword

parameters.name: filing-purpose
parameters.description: Classification explaining what intended use of the document within business. Commonly used filing purposes are arrangement-document, mandate-document and profile-photo. For a complete list of possible values see [filing-purpose]() classification.

parameters.name: filing-case-number
parameters.description: Identifies the case related to the document such as arrangment, loan application or complaint. Having this file enables flat folder structure where documents in one folder can belong to different cases.

Location.description: URI where document content can be downloaded

- [folder-archived]()

- [folder-archived]()

get.summary: Get document metadata by path and file name

delete.description: WARNING: This operation deletes both metadata and content stream

440.description:
Your request was refused due to business policy. Consider the following possible problems and look into response for more details:
- [document-locked]()
- [document-archived]()

Your request was well constructed but it does not comply with business policy. Consider the following possible problems and look into response for more details:
- [document-locked]()
- [document-archived]()

validation-problem-response.description: Your request was not constructed properly. Response contains the list of validation errors for each invalid element of your request. For complete list of possible validation errors see [validation errors]() classification.

default-error-response.description: Besides specific status codes above, other standard http [status codes](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html) can be returned for each request. To learn more see general guidance on [error handling]()

page-param.name: page
page-param.description: Page index. For more information see general guidance on [paging and sorting]()

page-size-param.name: page-size
page-size-param.description: Number of items on a page. For more information see general guidance on [paging and sorting]()

sort-order-param.description: Sort order (`asc` or `desc`). Default is asc. For more information see general guidance on [paging and sorting]()
sort-order-param.name: sort-order

sort-by-param.description: Attribute of the collection item to sort by. For more information see general guidance on [paging and sorting]()
sort-by-param.name: sort-by

include-param.description: List of fields to include in response. For more information see general guidance on [response shaping]()
include-param.name: include

trim-param.description: List of fields to trim from response. For more information see general guidance on [response shaping]()
trim-param.name: trim

search-query-param.name: q
search-query-param.description: The text to search for. All searchable fields are searched by default unless search-fields is specified. When searching searchable fields, the search text itself is tokenized, so multiple terms can be separated by white space (e.g. `q=hello world`).

search-fields-param.description: The list of comma-separated field names to search for the specified text. Target fields must be marked as searchable
search-fields-param.name: search-fields

search-mode-param.name: search-mode
search-mode-param.description: Specifies whether any or all of the search terms must be matched in order to count the document as a match.

search-content-param.name: search-content
search-content-param.description: Specifies wheather to search in document content

repository-name.name: repo
repository-name.description: Name of the repository such as `mchub` or `dms`

folder-id-param.name: id
folder-id-param.description: Unique identifier of folder in repository

document-id-param.name: id
document-id-param.description: Unique identifier of folder in repository

path.name: path
path.description: Path of the folder. Hiararchy of folders separated with forward slash eg. `folder1/folder2/folder3`. Leading and trailing slashes will be trimmed.

file-name.name: file-name
file-name.description: Name of the file with extension such as `image.jpg`

kind-param.name: kind
kind-param.description: Kind of content item to include in response. Default is `any`

errors.message: Format for this field is invalid
Check digit is invalid for this field

example.message: Document you are trying to a is locked by another user.
example.details: User john.doe has locked the document.

total-count.description: Total number of items in collection

total-pages.description: Total number of pages of set size

sort-order.description: Sort order (`asc` or `desc`). Default is asc

sort-by.description: Attribute of the collection item to sort by

content-item.description: Base content management object that contains fields shared between folders and documents

id.description: Unique identifier of folder or document within repository. Each repository may have different format of identifiers

changed-on.description: Time and date when document or folder was last changed

created-on.description: Time and date when document or folder was created

created-by.description: Identifier of the party (customer or agent) that created document or folder. Can be `system` when object was created by non-interractive backend process

name.description: Name of the file or folder. File names may include extension

folder.description: A container for documents and child folders.

folder-purpose.description: Classification explaining intended use of folder in business context. Commonly used values include generic-folder, client-folder, arrangement-folder, case-folder, order-folder. For a complete list of possible values see [folder-purpose]() classification

document.description: Represents elementary information entity managed by the repository

media-type.description: MIME Media Type that describes format of the docuements content stream as deﬁned by RFC2045 and RFC2046. Commonly used media type examples are image/png, image/jpg, application/pdf and application/msword

filing-purpose.description: Classification explaining what intended use of the document within business. Commonly used filing purposes are arrangement-document, mandate-document and profile-photo. For a complete list of possible values see [filing-purpose]() classification.

filing-case-number.description: Identifies the case related to the document such as arrangment, loan application or complaint. Having this file enables flat folder structure where documents in one folder can belong to different cases.

size.description: Size of the document in bytes
